Refactored legacy code to better leverage Angular JS strengths thereby increasing testability by conforming to the framework’s style. Added new angular components and functionality, while fixing outstanding defects.  Also, constructed a new multi-lingual/region login application page for card holders driven by jQuery/vanilla JS dynamically updating the DOM based on JSON data fetched from several sources asynchronously coupled with css media queries at strategic breakponts for responsive design.    Worked with gulp for automating builds and Jenkins for deployment.

As part of a small 2 person agile team built Inventory and Inside Sales dialing systems utilizing WebRTC, Angular JS powering the front end, with Express and Mongo handling the REST API and data.  Mocha/Chai for Unit Tests.  WebStorm IDE, Github and JIRA as dev tools.

This is project is in continuous development as a satirical news site with user generated content.   Tools used include a custom Wordpress implementation  with some unique php and jQuery pop-up Easter eggs. Revamped CSS and HTML in fTelnet HTML 5 telnet software to function on a mobile device, a first in the community. Designed all graphics, including animated GIFs and ASCII artwork for website and console.   Used javascript to build custom telnet server based off  Synchronet BBS software as Easter egg. Created console interface displaying live RSS feeds, chat and messaging with conditional formatting. Designed modules for Wordpress REST API and twitter to perform CRUD operations using javascript object prototypes. Reverse engineered 1977 BASIC code for Oregon Trail game and re-adapted it in javascript as a telnet console game with scores hosted on a remote object oriented database stored in JSON format.
Work to improve quality of Google search algorithm using a proprietary test methodology
